messages.content:
Dear Friend,
I love living in Cambridge. It's been my home for over 30 years... [text truncated for brevity]

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Stopping Brexit is the number one priority.
We must rescue our NHS and invest in our schools.

mentions.otherPartyLeaderCandidate: residents tell me that they cannot vote for a Labour MP whose party leader refuses to back Remain.
mentions.tacticalSituation: The polls show that I can win here in Cambridge, but we all know elections are unpredictable so every vote will count.

issues.brexitEurope:
Stopping Brexit is the number one priority.
...make sure that in Westminster, you have an MP whose whole party stands resolutely for Remain.
issues.education: We must rescue our NHS and invest in our schools.
issues.environment: We must combat the climate crisis.
issues.transport: I will fight for both our rail.

community.content: We've made lots of memories here, like trips with the kids to Midsummer Fair or watching the Christmas lights being switched on in the Market Square

examples: The polls show that I can win here in Cambridge, but we all know elections are unpredictable so every vote will count.
Stopping Brexit is my number one priority.
We must rescue our NHS and invest in our schools.
We must combat the climate crisis.
I will fight for both our rail.

personalStories.story: We've made lots of memories here, like trips with the kids to Midsummer Fair or watching the Christmas lights being switched on in the Market Square.

examples: residents tell me that they cannot vote for a Labour MP whose party leader refuses to back Remain.
residents tell me that they cannot vote for a Labour MP whose party leader refuses to back Remain.
residents tell me that they cannot vote for a Labour MP whose party leader refuses to back Remain.

nonPolicyAttributes.localness: I love living in Cambridge. It's been my home for over 30 years... [text truncated for brevity]
nonPolicyAttributes.family: It's where my wife, Eilis, and I first met and chose to put down roots.
